intro: Ampelocissus tenuis, commonly known as the slender leaf cat's claw, is a climbing plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, elongated leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Its fruits are small, round berries that turn red when mature, and the plant is often used in traditional medicine. Ampelocissus tenuis is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
